attributes.action: Allow MP's to freely vote on all motions.
attributes.additional_details: MP's were told how to vote and threatened with their jobs/future roles in the EU debate.  There was huge public interest in this vote with many feeling that their opinions are being ignored.  MP's are elected officials who work for the people.  They should therefore be allowed to consult with their constituents and form opinions which they can express in the house of commons.  Being told how to vote by party leaders is a huge insult to the people who voted for them.

rejection.details: Whipping is a matter for political parties and not HM Government
